sentences.sContent: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.sCn: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

sentences.sContent: ...But efforts are in place to expose more black...
...the robots in asimov's fiction expose complications and loopholes in the three laws...
...We need to expose ourselves to more art and literature in order to tell the superior from the inferior...
...But I’m more afraid to expose my unborn child to the radiation...

remMethod.val: ex(出) ＋ pos(放) ＋ e → 放出来 → 使暴露

trans.tranOther: to show something that is usually covered or hidden
